source_note: State baseline derived from Ohio EPA Division of Materials Management and city recycling programs.

organics.guidance: Composting of yard waste required by many municipalities; food waste composting expanding under Ohio EPA guidance.
organics.bin: Green/yard waste bin or compost drop-off site.
organics.notes: Cleveland and Columbus operate yard waste programs.
provenance: Ohio EPA Organics and Composting Program

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper and cardboard; flatten before recycling.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle bottles and jars (rinsed, no lids).

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum, steel, and tin cans (clean and empty).
metal_containers.notes: Exclude scrap metal or aerosol cans.

plastics.guidance: Recycle bottles, jugs, and tubs labeled #1â€“#2; local rules apply for others.
plastics.notes: No film, bags, or foam curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Ohio does not have a statewide container deposit law.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Recycle in local curbside or drop-off bin.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle batteries through HHW programs or retail collection sites.
household_batteries.notes: Keep out of trash and curbside recycling.

e_waste.guidance: E-waste recycling offered via local programs and events; no statewide landfill ban.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags and film not accepted curbside.
plastic_bags_and_film.notes: Plastic film causes contamination at facilities.

bulky_items.guidance: Bulky waste requires special pickup or landfill drop-off.
bulky_items.notes: Fees and scheduling vary by municipality.
provenance: City of Columbus bulky item collection
